channel.title: Selling 5 legit copies of L4D2 $5 Paypal
channel.description:
Sorry if this is not allowed here, but I thought it would be worth a go.
Today I bought the "Give and Get" deal of 6 copies of L4D2 for $25. Since I only need one copy I thought it would be beneficial to all if I sold these copies cheap.
I will be charging a small fee of $5 per copy, and have 5 copies to sell. All money will be transferred via paypal.
First in first serve.

item.title: Selling 5 legit copies of L4D2 $5 Paypal
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
I’m surprised that nobody pointed out that he essentially got L4D2 for free.

$25 down for 6 copies, $5 back for each copy he didn’t want.

item.title: Selling 5 legit copies of L4D2 $5 Paypal
item.dc:creator: loony636
item.description:
Fancy Pants:

um its not taking away from their revenue when they give you extra copies to give away

No, you buy more copies for a certain amount of money, which you can then give away gratis. Here, he’s giving them away for money. Just because he’s giving them away at cost price (or even below that) doesn’t matter; its going against Steam’s monopoly on sales, which is exactly what they don’t want.

Fancy Pants:

typing on the internet is not a measure of articulation, either. i could type like this. If I wanted to, I could type like this. its getting the same point across either way.

Right, you could type either way, but I thought that when you’re implying that someone has less than normal intelligence, it was generally best to use at least normal articulation to do so. The same point isn’t gotten across when a tlk lyk ths.

Fancy Pants:

also lol @ u implying i ever used the wrong form of your/youre

You didn’t; you just forgot the apostrophe.

leet:

Just sayin’.

Just sayin’. The only reason the site is still up is because of some weird rule over there that means the penalties they imposed (fines, prison time, injunctions) only take effect after all the appeals have gone through.

X_Mastershot_X:

God-Damn it! Shut up and leave already. You make me remember “Somebody is wrong on the internet” guy.

If Mods/ Devs thought this was bad for the Black Mesa forums, they would have locked this thread already.

If that’s their determination, then so be it. I was just voicing my opinion, and, as per internet tradition, its been summarily shat on. But if I remind you of xkcd, then that could only be a good thing.

But as has already been stated, can we all just move on? Its minor and almost insignificant as it is, and so long as we don’t all start doing it there’ll be absolutely no problems with Valve.

Read full topic

item.title: Selling 5 legit copies of L4D2 $5 Paypal
item.dc:creator: blue
item.description:
loony636:

There may not be criminal implications, but there are most certainly civil punishments that can be used. You all signed the agreement when you got Steam accounts, so they can all be shut down (and the games lost), and I’m fairly confident this website could, potentially, be shut down as part of an injunction. My legal knowledge doesn’t quite cover all of the relevant areas of law, but I think its safe to say that its much better for this website not to break any civil codes.

So stop it. I like it here. If you want to sell games, go elsewhere.

Oh man, you are such a fucking pussy, grow a pair. They earn cash, we get cheap games … bet they will close down the whole interwebz for this !!!

Read full topic

item.title: Selling 5 legit copies of L4D2 $5 Paypal
item.dc:creator: loony636
item.description:
Fancy Pants:

all i got from that post was "BAWWW IM BUTTHURT SOMEONE IS TRYING TO SULLY THE ALMIGHTY STEAM

No? I’d consider taking the chance of buying cheap second-hand Steam games elsewhere on the internet, just not here. Other forums are set up explicitly for that purpose, and there’s no need for this one to expose itself to liability aswell.

Fancy Pants:

EVERY COMPANY 100% FOLLOWS THROUGH ON EVERY LITTLE INSIGNIFICANT LETTER IN CONTRACTS

Given its a fairly major chunk of their revenue structure I’d hardly call it insignificant, but you can keep poking companies with a stick if you want, but do it on your own time.

Fancy Pants:

HOW YOU TYPE IS AN ENTIRELY VALID MEASURE OF YOUR INTELLIGENCE

Well aside from the fact articulation is a basic measure of intelligence, I would have thought that common decency suggest insults be conveyed with the very basics of grammar. But whatever. youre face.

Fancy Pants:

I SUCK COCKS

Only Ram’s. And only if there’s cake involved.

Fancy Pants:

somehow i think valve would put more effort into finding the people who are cracking their games than someone who made $5 off a game no one even likes anymore.

That’s probably true, but why bother taking the chance?

item.title: Selling 5 legit copies of L4D2 $5 Paypal
item.dc:creator: loony636
item.description:
Fancy Pants:

lol you really think valve would shut this forum down cause one guy sold a game

Well probably not, just because its unlikely to come to their attention. But repeated violations of the agreement might. Generally, facilitating violations of EULA is considered as bad as violating the EULA itself. Why else do you think TPB, Torrent Spy and a whole bunch of other websites have been shut down?

I just think that if the one company you need to keep onside to make this mod work is Valve, that would be the last company you would want to piss off. There are other websites you can go to do this kind of thing, we’re all happy to let all the liability rest on them.

Fancy Pants:

theyd ban him from steam AT THE VERY MOST.

Oh I’m sorry, I guess I missed the “Valve legal department” sticker right next to your name. My mistake.

Fancy Pants:

its a million times more likely they wouldn’t notice and if they did, they wouldn’t really care.

Yeah, because they put clauses in their contracts for shits and giggles.

Fancy Pants:

god damn youre retarded

If you’re going to call be retarded, the least you could do is use proper grammar. Its like the pot calling the kettle black so much I’m embarrassed for you.

I’m sorry for taking something seriously on the internet. You can all go back to fucking around now.

Read full topic

item.title: Selling 5 legit copies of L4D2 $5 Paypal
item.dc:creator: loony636
item.description:
russilker:

Reselling gifts on Steam is against the EULA, but as for whether or not it is punishable by law is disputable. Due to there being no explicit legal implications, its frowned upon by most websites just for the sake of being safe rather than sorry.

There may not be criminal implications, but there are most certainly civil punishments that can be used. You all signed the agreement when you got Steam accounts, so they can all be shut down (and the games lost), and I’m fairly confident this website could, potentially, be shut down as part of an injunction. My legal knowledge doesn’t quite cover all of the relevant areas of law, but I think its safe to say that its much better for this website not to break any civil codes.

So stop it. I like it here. If you want to sell games, go elsewhere.

Read full topic
item.source: Selling 5 legit copies of L4D2 $5 Paypal

item.title: Selling 5 legit copies of L4D2 $5 Paypal
item.dc:creator: russilker
item.description:
Reselling gifts on Steam is against the EULA, but as for whether or not it is punishable by law is disputable. Due to there being no explicit legal implications, its frowned upon by most websites just for the sake of being safe rather than sorry.

Now, selling unused CD keys is legal, but selling Steam accounts is illegal (while it isn’t likely to get you in any trouble with the law, it can easily get your Steam account disabled).

Read full topic

item.title: Selling 5 legit copies of L4D2 $5 Paypal
item.dc:creator: loony636
item.description:
Firepowzer:

I’m pretty sure that reselling a copyrighted game is really illegal. Pretty stupid to break copyright on a public forum full of people who use steam. I wouldn’t be suprised if one of the people you sell one to, if you do, reports you and gets you banned from steam or something.

The illegal thing would be if you resold the copyrighted game as your own. Did you know that I made Beckoning of Obligation 5: Darker-than-Grey Enterprise? Want it for $200?

StOnE:

lol… are you people serious? oh noes the big bad police iz gunna get yas!

The issue isn’t the police shutting you down, its Valve shutting THIS FORUM down for condoning something which is, at least in civil court, illegal.

Jnacool:

I’m pretty sure the sales of a digital copy of a game is not illegal it is just against the terms of service for Steam because at the end of the day they don’t want to be dealing with people who have been scammed.

Not at all; if they wanted to they could set up a legitimate eBay like reselling service quite easily. They want to stop this happening so they can make more money. People aren’t likely to give away games for free without receiving something in return, unless they are genuine gifts. That means if they can eliminate the second-hand market, they radically expand the first-hand market of people who have no choice but to buy their games.

Jnacool:

If you purchase 6 digital copies of the game and you want to transfer these to another account that perfectly legal, if you want to charge for your time to do this then again I don’t see how that could be disputed.

Because the first is a gratuitous gift and the other is a contract for sale. Those are entirely different. The second is in violation of the EULA and could, at the very least, result in the banning of your account. The first is completely fine and endorsed by Valve.

EDIT: Not only are you not able to transfer the gifts for money, you’re not even able to charge people to use them in any way. See the Subscriber Agreement, paragraph 1. You can see the answer to the question of “can I sell my gifts for money” here.

Unless you are a Licensed Cybercafe Operator (as defined below), this Agreement does not allow you to exploit the Software or any of its parts for any commercial purpose including, but not limited to, use at a Cybercafe, computer gaming center or any other location-based site.

Read full topic
item.source: Selling 5 legit copies of L4D2 $5 Paypal

item.title: Selling 5 legit copies of L4D2 $5 Paypal

I’m pretty sure the sales of a digital copy of a game is not illegal it is just against the terms of service for Steam because at the end of the day they don’t want to be dealing with people who have been scammed.

If you purchase 6 digital copies of the game and you want to transfer these to another account that perfectly legal, if you want to charge for your time to do this then again I don’t see how that could be disputed.

I’m just disappointed I didn’t see this thread earlier to be honest.
